Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable”
Reviews.Author: Ritchie F
Reviews.Content: I love Rome, I love everything about Rome, and the location of this hotel is absolutely stunning. The room is more than adequate (although I would avoid booking the breakfast in advance - I'm a fan of the usual cured meats, breads etc. that are usually on offer for breakfast in Italy but I found the meat incredibly fatty and the bread chewy - there are many restaurants around which do cheap nice breakfasts) We got a room facing the fountain and the view in the morning of the Trevi fountain is unbeatable - I brought my girlfriend to Rome to propose and the room, area, city, everything was perfect. If you're going to Rome to live in your hotel room for a few days then this might not suit - but if you're the type who goes out walking the streets and seeing the sights then you cannot get better than this. The beds were very roomy and comfortable and clean and there was always hot water. A+

Reviews.Title: “Novel hotel to stay in for the ultimate trevi fountain view.”
Reviews.Author: debbie L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not flashy or the best for facilities or space. But if you can get a room over looking the trevi fountain like we did, the view is amazing and the atmosphere very unique. It's a one off and a few nights only is required. Very central location with good places to eat nearby and great photo opportunities. Sore shoe shop below sell great shoes at good prices too so pop in there too to buy a few pairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fountain of wishes”
Reviews.Author: peternliz
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Rome at the end of February having spent four beautiful days at the Fontana Trevi.The hotel was a Monastery so expect old world charm and beams.Our room was a superior double which was at the back and overlooked roof tops. At first we thought we would have liked a Fountain view but soon realised that the noise of the crowds is 18 hours out of the 24 so consider before rushing for a fountain view. The staff were polite and helpfull, especially Issac who has been at the hotel 22 years.The room was excellent.Breakfast was great and enhanced by perhaps the best view in Rome.It was fascinating to see the authorities hoovering the coins out on a morning supervised by the ever present police.The Fountain is a place to people watch and is a vibrant hub of the city.An excellent location for all the sights ;walk everywhere and you see the real Rome.Trip Advisor before our city break was contrary to our experience.

Reviews.Title: “look at photos,and dont be put off.”
Reviews.Author: karen242
Reviews.Content: excuse the lack of punctuation im typing one handed,babe in arms.the hotel is with jumping distance of one of romes most visited attractions,and hello its a fountain with running water,so its going to be noisy. It isvisited everyday by thousands of visitors.the rooms are tiny,i stayed in the one shown on the proffesional photos of the hotel and to be honest you could not swing a cat,who cares when you have the trevi fountain all to yourself in the morning and late late at night.the top of the hotel where you can have a glass of wine after a hard day sight seeing is fab,taking in the amazing facia of the fountain.its in a nice part of rome,within a lovely evening walk to the spanish steps and flower market.its no exactly the hilton but i dont mind a small room i dont go to italy to sit in my room,as long as theres a clean bed(even if a bit uncomfy)you take the ruff with smooth.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - dreadful room”
Reviews.Author: Babs_Kendal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the most perfect position overlooking Trevi fountain. It’s easy walking distance to all the monuments and Vatican City. The view of the fountain from the breakfast room is excellent. We were given a room at the back which should have been quiet but the lift is so old and noisy it was impossible to sleep. I have never seen a double room so small or basic, I guess it was about 2m x 2.5m and the bed was pushed right up to the wall to allow enough room to walk past the other side. Yes it used to be a monastery but it's now a hotel and guests expect more than a basic bed and wardrobe. There wasn’t even a glass to rinse our teeth after brushing. It's a shame we didn't get one of the nice rooms shown on the website. The bathroom - I'll try not to be rude but it's very difficult and here goes: you can sit on the toilet, brush your teeth in the washbasin, soak your feet in the bidet and wash your hair in the shower all at the same time. Get the picture? Breakfast was lovely and there was plenty on Sunday and Tuesday but Monday was a problem when there was no juice, cold meat, bread rolls or pastries and we had to ask. Don't be afraid to speak out, you've paid for breakfast so ask for it. The breakfast lady on Sunday and Monday was not friendly and some would say she was rude but I know how tourists can be tiresome and will leave you to decide for yourself. The young lady on Tuesday was really nice and attentive. Staff on reception were nice apart from one who seemed a bit stuffy but I won’t make any comments because you never know whether someone is just having a bad day. The porter is the nicest, genuine person I have ever met on holiday. He is full of information and has a smile every time you see him. All in all it’s ok for the money because of the location but you can get better accommodation a lot cheaper if you’re not bothered about the view. A word of warning about the taxis - be on your guard! We were taken for a ride (sorry for the pun) and were charged 28 euros for a 1.5km ride (the clock said 26). We only had 2 x 20 euro notes and the driver drove off at great speed with our change. Walk everywhere, you will see more and walk off the pizza, pasta and vino calories!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DJIRVING
Reviews.Content: Small rooms for the price but great location. Located in front of the famous Trevi fountain, a short walk to nearly evrything important; the colosseum, the roman forum, the constantine arch, piazza nevada and the famous streets for shopping, there is also a bus stop with buses going to Vatican City for 1 euro

Reviews.Title: “What a View!!”
Reviews.Author: Chele32789
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the simplest, least fancy hotel I've ever stayed in that warrants an excellent review. The hotel is an old monastery that overlooks the Trevi Fountain. The opportunity to sleep, wake up and eat breakfast overlooking the fountain is the attraction. The rooms are more than basic - they are monastic, of course. But pretty in their simplicity. I loved being there in my peaceful room as the tourists start to gather in the morning or as they eat gelato and socialize in the late evening. This hotel warrants only a one-night stay, however. Get the view and the memories one night and then get comfortable after that!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small & noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: 695emma
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the main tourist attractions. Our room was very small, bathroom was tiny and after the shower there was water all over the bathroom floor. Breakfast service is very rude. Probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel if you do not want to spoil your holiday”
Reviews.Author: sahar o
Reviews.Content: I agree with Alison, Julia and Jovik. Poor service all the way through, old furniture ,bed was not comfortable, small rooms, so noisy with the fountain and tourists, could not sleep due to noise. I paid 230 Euro for one night in this 3 star hotel with absolutely no service. I was in the room with so called view but i had to clime up the window to see something. For this price i was at least expecting a good or average breakfast. I had to clean my own table and when i complained about the breakfast i was told if i can not wait i should have brought someone from my house to serve me a breakfast!!!!!!!!!!! the manager was soooooooooooooooooooooooo RUDE. unbelievable. unfortunately I will always remember the beautiful Trevi Fountain with this terrible memory from Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great view,shocking service.”
Reviews.Author: Julia05307
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location but appalling service.Arrived at breakfast on our last morning to find no clean table so cleared one ourselves.There was no juice ,no pastries- actually there wasn't much.Another guest phoned the manager to say help was needed.He arrived upstairs and in front of all the guests he told us we had to wait in a very rude manner! The room was nice, great view from the window although very noisy,but as for the bathroom-impossible to fit in the bath even to use the shower nozzle !!I definitely would not choose to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “5*Location 1*Service Oct 12th 2011”
Reviews.Author: Alison H
Reviews.Content: I am writing this as I feel compelled to advise travellers who might be on the verge of booking this hotel to think twice. I was staying at the hotel at the same time as Jovik below, so I can vouch for the fact the the manager Andrea Arte is SO RUDE it is beyond belief that he is working in the Customer Service Industry let alone on the front desk of a Hotel. Let me start by saying if you want to be on the doorstep of the Trevi Fountain you will find this hotel is right there. Be warned it is noisy all night and early morning with tourists and vendors setting up their stalls and also the fountain is cleaned each morning, so request a room at the back.Upon arrival I was given the key and went to check out the room as I knew my friend(who I was sharing with) had requested a room with a view. Fair enough the room was on the 1st floor with a view but NO SHOWER, I went down to reception to be told "if you want a shower in your bathroom you must request that at the time of booking".Where in the world would you have to request a shower in your bathroom, so my friend and I battled with a hand-held shower attachment....not easy for the slimmest of people! Now I was present at the breakfast incident. The waitress, well she wasn't really that as she couldn't even manage a smile let alone clear away the tables. My friend and I and an Iranian lady cleared the tables ourselves. The Iranian lady called the Manager to try and explain the lack of service at breakfast, he hung up on her....shows the level of service. He eventually arrived up at the breakfast room to shout to people "why can't you all wait for 10mins for you food". This was shocking, the guests were in the hands of the staff, the food was average, croissants and pastries are bought in tins from shops, and then cooked on site so they are like bricks when they come out of the oven. No fresh fruit apart from Prunes, all in all a poor choice. My friend had a guest come over to see her at the hotel and she ordered a cup of tea and mineral water, this came to 6Euros...outrageous! Also just to top things off I had a hole in my duvet cover and no mattress protector on the beds....could do better! Please do not use this hotel as it will certainly spoil your holiday. Rome is a beautiful city marred by some of the people. this hotelk

Reviews.Title: “No good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jovik
Reviews.Content: My best advice is: Book upgraded room, superior. All other rooms are VERY small and windows to the back. Upgraded rooms are fronteed to the fonten and have aircondition. The breakfast was terrible, and the manager was rude when we tryed to complain on breakfast. All in all, avoid this hotel

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: bornadventurer
Reviews.Content: Rooms were small but clean and cosy , we were thrilled that we had a room with a view but when I opened the shutters there was scaffolding right in front of the window but this didn't spoil our stay there . The staff were very friendly and helpful . When we stepped out of the main entrance the Trevi fountain was right in front of us , we were walking distance to all the main attractions .

Reviews.Title: “You get your money's worth”
Reviews.Author: Takinogawa
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. our room, facing the back, was relatively quiet. we paid 130€ per night- which we thought was a great price for a hotel in this stunning location. the room was nice and clean, with very tiny shower, though. the breakfast room on top was supberb, especially the view towarda the trevi fountain. service lady at breakfast is grumpy, though. isaac, carried our luggage upstairs, is a gem. staff was ok. i recommend this hotel, especially because of its incredibly central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!”
Reviews.Author: girlygirl77
Reviews.Content: I just returned from another trip to Rome and the Hotel Fontana. As a hotelier myself and a well-travelled snob (for lack of a better term) I prefer to stay in delux 4* or 5* properties and I will be the first to admit that at first glance, this hotel does not fall into those categories...HOWEVER, I refuse to stay anywhere else when I travel to Rome. Yes the hotel only has 25 small and somewhat odd shaped rooms, and yes maybe you have to stand sideways in the tub because its not wide enough for your feet, and maybe the lobby doesn't display the glam factor of the Bellagio. Its true you're not going to find Molton Brown in the bathroom or Frette on the beds, and there is no iron/board or mini-bar in the room (but there are flat screens and SKY at least in our Superior room there was) but what the hotel lacks in glitz it more than makes up for in romance. Orginally built as a monestary, the preservation of the building allows the history to seep through, wrapping you in the warmth that is displayed not only the city, but by the staff (especially Issac) The view from the rooftop overlooking is breathtaking and probably my favorite room so I might ask to rent that part of the hotel during my next visit! I opted for a fountain side room this time and with the windows closed and air con on we only heard the peaceful flow of the fountain...it wasn't noisy or obtrusive as described in other reviews (and I'm a light sleeper) and we stayed Fri-Sun so there were plenty of people around at all hours. I'm already planning my next visit but won't travel unless I can book at the Hotel Fontana.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: uma K
Reviews.Content: Booked superior double room through Expedia based on the description on the hotel website, which claims a view of the Travi Fountain. However, upon check-in we discovered that the view was blocked by a giant billboard that was attached to the maintenance scaffolding. The billboard had an advertisement for a car. The hotel must be making money of that billboard. It was not mentioned in their or Expedia website that there was a billboard obstructing the view of the fountain. When asked about relocation to other rooms with a view, the front desk refused. They also refused to adjust rate to ordinary double room rate which is 20 euros less. We are very disappointed with the deception and rip-off. There is no hanger for bathroom tissue, and commode does not hold enough water resulting in the stuff being stuck on the walls of commode. It had to flushed several times and brushed off with commode brush. To make it worse, the commode takes several minutes to fill between each flush. At the time of checkout, the front desk manager insisted that we pay cash to pay the city taxes (which came to 32 euros). We did not have case, and we wanted pay by credit card. He then gives a form to fill out stating that we refuse to pay the city tax. When we refuse to sign that form, he calls police to scare us. Police tell us that we can pay by credit card. We then paid by credit card. Police also told us that, if we did not pay, the form will be given to the police, and they can cofiscate our passports and we have to pay the double the amount as penalty. Overall, this is not a good hotel to stay, very small and cramped, lousy bathroom, and no good service or view. Expedia related: Expedia customer service contact number does not have a clear choice for complaints. The English of the agents was hard to follow. They did not follow up and call the hotel with my complaint. They only would attempt to call hotel during our call. So, we had to make several calls, and finally had to get up in the morning to make sure they call the hotel during the hotels working hours. They finally said that the hotel refused to accept responsibility. We expected Expedia, with its clout and size, would be able to make the hotel change their web page information, and to get them to offer a reasonable compensation for misleading us and not providing us what they promised. Disappointed with Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but reception staff were less than friendly”
Reviews.Author: JuliePollard
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small with very basic amenities. Great to so close to the fountain but the noise keeps you awake if you select a room overlooking the fountain. Breakfast was the worst of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “You pay for location not room”
Reviews.Author: aidavat
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a single room. The room was literally the size of a double bed and no window but an opening in the ceiling. Apparently double rooms are nicer but none were available. However it was clean and of course the location was very convenient. Still, not worth the 180 euro pricetag.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this vintage "Old Rome" hotel with the Trevi Fountain at our doorstep.”
Reviews.Author: GoTravelAL
Reviews.Content: We found out about the renovations by email, decided to stay there anyway and loved it. We booked "Superior" rooms and they were great; one in the back of the hotel with a lovely barreled ceiling bathroom, and one in the front with a little entry hall leading into the main room. Both baths had a tub/shower. The beds were quite firm so if this is an issue for you, take note. The Trevi fountain was at the doorstep. Cute little gelato shops, grocery/coffee shops, and gift shops were in the storefronts adjacent to the hotel surrounding the fountain area. One especially nice leather goods store was a favorite. Be aware that the hotel is on a pedestrian only street and so you do have to carry your bags about a block and 1/2 to get to and from the hotel for check in/out. We loved the atmosphere around the hotel and fountain and getting to see the Trevi every time we left and returned to the hotel. If you are not into old houses, antiques, the authentic "Old Rome" feel, you might not like this hotel. But for us, it was perfect and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: cap0d1tutt1
Reviews.Content: Like most people, I choosed this hotel for its great location, and didn't regretted about it. Yes, my room was very small. Honestly, it was the smallest hotel room I ever live before. But for me it wasn't a problem at all. Being in the eternal city, it's quite strange to hang out at a hotel for whole day, isn't it? Bathroom was also very small, and it would be a real problem for a corpulent person to take shower there. But the room cleaning service was excellent (well, it should be easy to clean such little rooms, hehe). Breakfast served at the top of building, with beautiful sight on the fontain. Food - nothing special, there were some ham and cheese and a cup of coffee. Hotel also provides internet service (wi-fi only). It costs about 2eur for 1 hour. Staff was friendly and helpful, I hadn't any problems with them. My overall impression: it is an average hotel, not very cheap due to its really perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Tackline
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome & this hotel was the perfect location for seeing the sites. Our bathroom was fairly small, but the room was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing accommodation but wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: cat063
Reviews.Content: We too were given a room like a cell, two narrow twin beds, old furniture, poor tv, not even a mirror in the bedroom and tiniest wet room. However, they moved us to a better room (still quite small and with almost unusable shower room) without too much fuss but the receptionist did say the room rate we had paid was very cheap. We agree it was cheap and I suppose you get what you pay for, however the website is over glamourised and we did expect better. The breakfast room has an amazing view but the breakfast and service is dreadful, we only had it once preferring to go out on subsequent days. There was no sign of cocktails being served as promised by the website. The noise of the fountain and associated socializing which goes on around it is constant and 24 hours a day. The location is great so if you want a hotel within walking distance of all sights it's fine but don't expect any frills!

Reviews.Title: “WAIT, DON'T EVEN CONSIDER!!”
Reviews.Author: smartdesigner
Reviews.Content: Okay, I guess “DON’T EVEN CONSIDER” might be a little heavy handed. The location couldn’t be more spectacular, but that’s where it all ends. We could hardly wait to get to this hotel, which had sounded like a very special place… And for that price, it should have been! I don't know where they found those photos that they show online, but they must be masters of Photoshop! When we arrived at the “lobby” we were already a little frightened. The reception was less than cordial and the “atmosphere” was dingy and we were handed a key on the end of a very large chunk of carved wood and off we went. The halls were cluttered and dirty, (very dirty) and when we opened the door to our room we were crestfallen. We’ve stayed in some uncomfortable little rooms before, but nothing like this. When I say that it felt like a convent, I’m being generous. There were thee twin size beds lined up with one table between two of them. At the foot of the bed, if you turned sideways, you could squeak past a very old, but not antique, chunk of a table with a tiny little t.v. on it. There was one dining type chair in the corner and a really nice but TOO LARGE armoire on another wall. The bathroom had a stool that one couldn’t sit on or stand near without leaning sideways because of a big towel rack on one wall. The toilet seat was falling off and cracked so we ended up using facilities at a bar down the street. The “shower” was no larger than 24” X 24” and had a dirty curtain wrapping two sides of it, and if you lost your balance you would end up on the cracked toilet seat anyway so we skipped that too. The other side of the shower was shielded by the bidet but that had ants crawling in it, so we wouldn’t want to fall that direction either. To further complicate matters, they used some kind of powerful deodorant or commercial cleaning and it smelled really bad! We got the hell out the next day and promised ourselves that we would get back on Tripadvisor and warn any and all! YIKES, we felt like we were in a cell!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Fontana - location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Moment-of-truth
Reviews.Content: Having stayed previously in Rome, the location of this small, middle value hotel was the highlight. The Fontana di Trevi (Trevi Fountain) is directly outside the entrance. If you don't like crowds - stay away as hourds of tourists stand infront of the fountain at all hours of the day. I love the Trevi Fountain and found staying here - incredibly romatic. The location to every site in Rome i easy to access from this central point by foot. The highlight washaving a gelati at night, seeingt the fountain and having an array of fabulous restaurants simply outside your front door. Great shopping is just around th corner also. All my fabourites, including Massimo Dutti which has the best mens and womens collections for relaxed but sophisticated day wear. The hotel is nothing extraordinary - rather on the simple side. The rooms verge on small - but this is Rome. They are clean and neat. The breakfast room truly overlooks the Trevi Fountain and this is where you will get your best photo. You simply cannot get the whole fountain in the frame, from street level. This hotel is good value for Rome, excellent location - in close proximity to all my favourite piazza's or squares. We managed to see all our favourite sites by running around from this fabulous location. If you're after a clean, small, quiet hotel that is comfortable with no frills - I will recommend it to you. We find we spend most of our days out and about in Rome, with only sleep time spent in the room, hence this basic convenience suffices our needs in this amazing city. Comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “all about the view”
Reviews.Author: Thorough-Traveler
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself was pretty average the breakfast area was great the rooms view were amazing! the beds and bathroom were average but they were clean,but lets face it if you take away the view there is no reason to stay there,the hotel at best is a 3 star,I would stay there again but im a sucker for a amazing view.my rating it a very good hotel is purely location, view

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Samanthao186
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 11 different locations in 30 days. This was the most expensive and the lowest quality. We had 2 rooms. One had no AC and with temps outside of 40'C, and hotter inside. My children slept in this room for one night until a new room opened up the next day. With the exception of one helpful staff member, customer service is very low priority. When I advised the receptionist that my door lock was broken and I couldn't get into my room she answered with 'what do you want me to do about it'. We were locked out for one hour in the hall with no air con or ventilation. TV reception is poor or non-existent. Free wi-fi is in fact not free & only available in the rooftop terrace. Location is excellent - walking distance to most sights. But the number of people that gather at the fountain until well into the wee hours is astounding.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic accommodation, OK standard”
Reviews.Author: CumbriaCharlie
Reviews.Content: We had checked out the website and thought this looked a really pretty hotel, at a good discounted rate, in the centre of the city. When we got there, we were told we couldn't check in until 3, and then we discovered we were in a small, basic room at the back with the tiniest bathroom known to mankind. Shower, toilet, basin and bidet were squeezed into a space the size of a normal shower. It was impossible to go to the toilet without having feet i the shower and simultaneously burning your arm on the towelrail! Great amusement ensued! The breakfast room was lovely, overlooking the Trevi Fountain , and the waitress Dana was lovely, speaking different languages and serving excellent food promptly. The well-spoken porter Isaac was great too, but it must be said that the rest of the staff were not overly welcoming. Overall, we were not disappointed with our stay, but could not wholeheartedly recommend the hotel. I wouldn't say "don't stay there" either. The pictures look great but the reality is not quite as charming. Hey ho!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in rome”
Reviews.Author: Aka086
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a disgrace. The only good thing about it is the location but there are a million hotels in the area which are much nicer. Asked at reception for wine glasses and the response was "maybe later". We never got them. Service really was a disgrace. The rooms are tiny and not clean. Was booked and had prepaid for 5 nights left after the second even though we could not get our money back. Just had to get out of that place. Found a much nicer hotel about 20 metres away.

Reviews.Title: “Con Artists and Theives”
Reviews.Author: aerobaticinstructor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Fontana Roma at 1930 on November 30, 2009. It was raining and dark. Once at the hotel the hotel personnel stated that someone had just cancelled the 3 reservations we had, then rebooked the hotel. Without notice or explanation, the hotel rates were now significantly more expensive. I informed the Hotel that we would be checking out in the morning (DEC 01). On the morning of DEC 01, the Hotel Fontana Roma stated that I had to pay for 3 nights, the extortion total was 1840.00 Euros. Without paying this amount, they stated they would prevent us from leaving the hotel. Their claim was that the reservation was for 3 days, even though they stated the previous night that the reservations had been cancelled! This was totally unacceptable. I paid the bill and stated that I was going to dispute the charge. This amount is not in keeping with my original confirmation, nor the Hotel Fontana Roma's own on-line prices and cancellation policies.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in beautiful Rome”
Reviews.Author: mbgSheffieldUk
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the Fontana hotel from sept 25th to sept 28th 09, we stayed in room 108 which had a view overlooking the trevi fountain, the room was a little small but adequate and very clean, there was hot water, fresh towels and clean bedding so we could not ask for more. The furniture and decor of the room was in keeping with the hotel, old but charming, the hotel dates back 2 hundred years before the trevi fountain was built and the hotel was originally a monastry so if your seeking atmosphere and character this is the hotel for you, it certainly adds to the feeling that you are staying in the eternasl city. The hotel is within minutes walk to the spanish steps, the pantheon, piazza navona and the colossuem, we took a short taxi ride to the vatican and the castel sant angelo but we could have walked there had i not been so impatient to see them on the first afternoon that we arrived in rome.The staff were pleasant and helpful and although this hotel is a little expensive for its 3 star rating, its location is priceless, the crowds gathered throughout the day and night around the fountain add to wonderful atmosphere. If you are considering going to Rome dont hesitate book it now and go, Rome is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fall asleep to the rushing waters of Trevi Fountain!”
Reviews.Author: thehag
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Fontana is at it's best during the week when the crowds are smaller out by the Trevi Fountain. It was heavenly falling asleep with our window open to the sounds of the fountain. Saturday night was a bit loud until really late (2:00 a.m.) so we couldn't sleep with the window open. The window kept most of the noise dulled though. The location was just perfect for the Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, The Pantheon, Quirinale, and wonderful shopping. It was very easy to find cabs to take you further away and the bus stop is within a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: avalen01
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, sleeping portion of the room was very good, however the bathroom was tiny and hard to work with. Sondro was one of the men working at the front desk and he was fantastic. Responded to every question, every request, and was quite comical in his interactions, he is to be singled out as a great employee

Reviews.Title: “Exellent location”
Reviews.Author: Whitlingham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights the rooms are very tiny but perfectly formed, we asked to change from the first one we were given as the bathroom was minute ( don't drop the soap in the shower or you will never pick it up ) the second bathroom was slightly bigger. We had rooms looking out over the Trevi Fountain which was a bit noisy until you closed the shutters but a superb view. The breakfast room is very small with tiny tables & chairs which are too high for the table, bit of a balancing act, on 3 days there was only one person doing the waiting, & there were not enough tables if everyone went to breakfast at the same time. It was a bit dull with only water melon, prunes & grapes with seeds never any other fruit & the things on the buffet ran out & were not always replenished in a timely manner. Also the air conditioning was inadequate & on 2 occaisions we had to leave early as the room was so hot. The staff at reception were very pleasant & the porter who helped with our luggage was great, we were lucky with good weather but there was no public space at all in this hotel so in bad weather you would only have been able to sit on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Make this your ONLY stay while in Rome!”
Reviews.Author: kscubagirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on our first night, but everyone in the hotel had no problem getting us settled, showing us around and recommending a fantastic restaurant around the corner. The views from the breakfast room are unbeatable and if you are like me and like to eat cheese and salami for breakfast, THIS IS YOUR PLACE!!!! Located in the BEST central location in Rome, close enough to do the touristy shopping hustle and bustle and easy enough to get around and go sight seeing and VERY quiet at night, no street noise at all. I highly recommend anyone going to Rome on a city break stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Bad, very bad.... don't stay here (you've been warned)”
Reviews.Author: lisndave
Reviews.Content: The only thing this place has going for it is it's location.... right across from Trevi Fountain. But I found that to be quite annoying very quickly with hundreds (possibly thousands) of people directly outside the hotel making all kinds of noise (I'm only 27 years old and I didn't like it), sitting and hanging out on the steps of the hotel. The hotel staff were absolutely no help whatsoever and would not speak/look at you unless you made the first move. The room was very very tiny (even for Europe) and it had the smallest shower I've ever seen in my life. I kept the soap and shampoo on the toilet the entire time because there were no holders and it was too small to keep on the ground. Walls are very very thin and could feel vibrations from people walking above AND next door (never had that happen before). The area is nice but this is just an awful hotel for 3 stars. I've stayed at 1 and 2 star hotels in Europe and some have been better than this one. You do not get your money's worth here. This is one of those places where you feel like you are an inconvenience to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ncrossland2002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with lots of good places to eat close by. We walked from the train station with our luggage in about 15 minutes. The hotel staff was very nice and informative about the area. Except for the last day there was a man in a suit with the dress shirt unbuttoned 3-4 buttons down who was rude. He in no way hurt the hotel ratings I just thought I should mention him since he was the only negative. We could hear the noise from the crowd at the fountain at night but we were so tired from walking and wine that it never bothered us. FYI: If you want an intimate picture in front of the fountain with a spouse or yourself wake up early and walk downstairs and take your photo, because around 10am-12pm it's shoulder to shoulder people. The hotel room is not very spacious but perfect if you just need a clean and safe place to sleep, shower, and change clothes. The bathroom is about 4 foot by 4 foot including shower, toilet, sink, bidet, and small shelf (its a tight fit). The shower was actually great, I loved it. The breakfast area was very nice overlooking the fountain and the food and coffee were good. FYI: If you are planning on a long day drink the water from the fountains it's a life saver, and doesn't taste too bad. It will keep you cool, going longer, and hydrated for when you want that beer/wine for lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The View made up for any shortfalls.”
Reviews.Author: denifish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed 6 nights at the Fontana room 306 mid October 08. I feel 277 Euros was expensive but this was a dream holiday, how much is that worth? I choose the hotel for the view and the absolute central location. Fountain is moderately loud so if you may find it difficult to sleep if you are used to sleeping with no background noise. Personally the sound of the fountain and the happy crowds below added to the entire experience. Breakfast was very pleasant. The lift is tiny. We nearly always walked the three flights of stairs which are steep but think of the health benefits! I cant imagine staying anywhere else now but the cost hurts.

Reviews.Title: “Take our advise!!! Go Elsewhere!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dulajax
Reviews.Content: They used the excuse that there was water damage in one of the rooms and had to move those guest into our room. We requested a special room for our 25th and had made the reservations 4 months in advance..We were told it is a "small room" but that we look like such a romantic couple, that it would be perfect for us. This room was #307. The room was smaller than a bathroom suite we just had in Tuscany!!! We did everything not to be in that room other than to sleep for the night and get the heck out of there in the morning. The bathoom smelled of shower curtain mildew, the air conditioner leaked so bad we put water glasses out to catch the drips. Naturally we did not sleep because we kept hearing the drips. The bedspread was so thin, it looked like it was 20 years old. It felt like we were given the servants quarters. Needless to say, when they said they would "accommodate" the price, it was for the single room at full price of 200 Euro. The staff was rude when we checked out. They got our money, they really did not care. No taxi service can make it to the front of the hotel because of all the people traffic for the Fountain. Be prepared to walk with your luggage for about a block. Take our advise, there are better hotels out there for your hard earned money!!! We tried contacting Public Relations at Hotel Fontana about this and have been ignored.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful days”
Reviews.Author: curious_guyAachen
Reviews.Content: we (a couple in the 40s) have been staying in this hotel for 5 nights. the hotel is in small building which was once (17th century) a monastry; it is located just opposite of the famous Fontana di Trevi. the hotel itself is absolutely romantic, and so is the location. We really loved our room with a view on the fountain. It has been the most romantic stay of our life! Of course, you have to be prepared for such a building and such a location. If you are looking for the comfort and luxury of a modern hotel within this price category, then this is not your place. The floors are old, and hence, uneven. The walls and the windows belong to a building of the 17th century. The noise coming through the window day and night is that of the fontana fountain, sounding like the ocean, and that of a a crowd of happy and friendly people enjoying the atmosphere. It was so tremendously beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and fab!”
Reviews.Author: DaireDublin
Reviews.Content: We loved this special hotel. It is a small, quirky and slightly shabby hotel right in front of the Trevi Fountain but it was wonderful. If you want luxury do not stay here. If you want atmosphere in a unique Italian Hotel this is the place for you. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Style!”
Reviews.Author: trip2ship
Reviews.Content: My party of 3 booked two view rooms, but slight mix up upon arrival got us only one fountain view rm. (My friend was willing to take the non-view rm - her main concerns were a clean room & comfortable bed & she said her rm. met her expectations.) Our rm. on the 2nd level was quite small but clean, tastefully furnished, with a spectacular view of the Trevi! Bathrooms had updated/modern facilities with lots of hot wtr! If you love old world style, you will love the antiques & art throughout. There is a tiny lift, but couldn't fit us all plus our luggage, so we took the creaking stairs (adding to the ambiance!) *As nice as it was to overlook the gorgeous Trevi Fountain, if you are a light sleeper, the sound of the waters might keep you awake. (just something to think about before booking a view rm.) *The breakfast service on the Rooftop terrace started at 7am, giving us plenty of time to enjoy delicious food, nicely presented, before our flight out. The view from this rooftop was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Better hotels close by.”
Reviews.Author: billtayloroz
Reviews.Content: We were lied to from the start. We were told the room we had booked had "hydraulic" problems. Thought it was a story but prepared to give the benefit of the doubt. Room we were given was 2mx4m with single beds for a couple on their 30th anniversary. We were supposed to get a room with a view of the fountain the next night. More lies. We had to argue just to get a room with a double bed. Truly not worth the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: funvoyage
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had an adorable room overlooking the Trevi Fountain; the view was almost 'too good to be true'. We think this hotel is perfect for travellers in search of authentic Italian charm.

Reviews.Title: “Choose your stay the authentic way!”
Reviews.Author: IWork2Live
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 3 nights in Rome where we stayed at the lovely Hotel Fontana. I would definitely recommend room 204 - ok, so no view of the Trevi Fountain but this means you get a good night's sleep and much appreciated air con. The breathtaking view from the breakfast room, which is intimate, light and airy, should satisfy your need for seeing the Trevi Fountain. We were shown to our room by one of the friendly porters and he also took us to see the breakfast room and gave us some handy info as well as complimentary water/biscuits. We paid for a superior and the room was fairly spacious-although the bathroom probably the smallest I've ever seen (!), with robes, very clean - something I am known for being fussy about- and full of rustic charm. Some of the furniture is old and worn but what you'd expect in a protected 14th Century former Monastery and I loved all the little chairs/lamps and tables along the hallways. My only gripe is that there were no bath towels when we arrrived and until day 2 - drying yourself on a tea towel is not ideal but really no big deal when it's hot. We were there to see Rome and it was the perfect base. With this hotel, you are also paying for the location, it's easy walking distance from almost all the major sites and has the world famous San Crespino ice cream parlour round the corner. A couple of tips: get to breakfast fairly early or there won't be anything left. We got there at 10am on the first morning just as they were about to pack up the toaster but on our last morning, at 8 am, there was loads of choice and it was great. Secondly, when you get to Rome, take the train from the airport to Termini (11 euros each) and then a taxi (don't pay more than 10 euros) to the hotel or alternatively walk it in 15 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent - but you need to get the better rooms”
Reviews.Author: BasilBrush1969
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quaint and old-style, a welcome relief to chain hotels and makes you feel like you are in Rome not a Travelodge! However the experience will depend much on which room you get - we booked a 'deluxe' room and were offered a top floor box (I think this is described as the prison cell in some other reviews which I can understand!). Needless to say we complained and from the second night were changed to a much nicer large room with 2 double beds and a high beamed ceiling and antique furniture. This experience was unecessarily annoying - why can't they just provide the room you have booked, to avoid the hassle on arrival? If you want a fountain view you need to stipulate this when booking or get lucky (unlikely in peak season)- however you may prefer a room away from the noise of the crowds, which can go on until the early hours, you can always use the breakfast room to see the view. Location excellent, immediately opposite the Trevi Fountain, and walking distance to all the major sights via Pedestrian areas & side streets, including the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Colosseum, Piazza Navona (all about 5 - 15 mins). We even walked to the Vataican. Otherwise there is a taxi stopping point next to the fountain. By the way since Sep 2006 there is a fixed taxi price of 40euros to/from the airport, this is listed in the back of the cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling booking experience”
Reviews.Author: J0nn0
Reviews.Content: I was planning on spending a night in Rome with my wife en-route to somewhere else and we decided to book at the Hotel Fontana at the Trevi Fountain. The website offers no phone number, just an email address. I found the number via Italy's Yellow Pages and rang - was told by an uninterested staff member the hotel only takes bookings by email, and please include my credit card details. But yes, they had a room facing the fountain for the date I wanted. Not an ideal situation, given I didn't know what sort of room or price I was going to get, let alone what else my card details might be used for. Never heard back from them so emailed again. Still no response. Rang and got no answer. Finally rang again and got through to someone who said they hadn't received my email, and the hotel was fully booked. Sorry. Of course I was a little angry, but take this as a warning: always get confirmation of a booking, especially from an establishment that seems to take the oxymoron "Italian organisation" to new lows!

Reviews.Title: “A great quirky base”
Reviews.Author: Mango_Espadrille
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for three nights over the extremely busy Easter period. The first thing to say would be whatever you do, DO NOT get a taxi to this hotel - it is situated in a pedestrian area and it took forever to get through the crowds. The taxi cost us a whopping 100 euros, but on the way back we got the nearby subway to the central train station and from there got a clean, efficient, comfortable train to the airport: it took us about an hour and cost approximately 30 euros in total for the two of us! Anyway, on to the hotel itself. The location is something of a mixed blessing; yes, the fountain (literally right outside the door) is beautiful but the crowds and noise it attracts would've been unbearable if our room was at the front of the hotel. As it turned out, we were dissappointed to find our room was at the back of the hotel, overlooking some offices. It was, however, relatively peaceful. Peaceful and comparable in size to a shoebox! We immideately asked to be moved, but were told politely that this wouldn't be possible as the hotel was full - you could definitely tell that they were used to dealing with this kind of request! And so we remained in the shoebox. It comprised of a hallway with an antique (or just old?!) wardrobe and a small side table. The bed was down a step and was pushed against the wall, with a small nightstand wedged in the non-wall side. There was about a foot of space between the end of the bed and the wall, and a small portable TV. The bathroom, comprising sink/bidet/toilet/shower and a window, was concealed behind a sliding mirror. Now, I know what you're thinking: this sounds like hell. But to be perfectly honest, there's so much to see and do in Rome that we were barely there. Bizarrely, if we'd had a better room it would've gone to waste! When we were in the room, the tiny proportions of the bed were actually quite romantic - we were forced to cuddle up to fit in it! So ironically enough, this turned out to be a perfect place to stay in Rome. The only disappointment turned out to be the 'roof terrace'. It was disappointing because there is no roof terrace! There's a breakfast area with horrid perspex windows where two tables look out onto the fountain, but to be honest it seemed pretty pointless when you can go and see the fountain in approximately 15 seconds just by leaving the hotel. To sum up, despite our inital reservations about the room size we had a great stay at this quirkily-decorated hotel. It makes a great base for sight-seeing and is staffed by typical Romans: polite but without that irritating fake over-niceness. We would recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: explore1huddersfield
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the end of Feb 07 and we couldnt have asked for anything more! We stayed in room 106 and it directly over looked the Trevi Fountain. Never had a view so spectacular from a hotel window - our first words were wow! The hotel is really well located with a metro station 5 mins walk away. 4euro's for a day ticket. The hotel staff were v helpfull and gave us a map and recommended local restraunts etc.. The breakfast is exactly what it says it is. Contenental. Bread, ham and cheeses which is perfectly fine! Our room was nice and clean and was cleaned daily. We even got white fluffy bathrobes! Room was fine in size same as premier lodge room. We did book a superior room. I guess if you dont you wont get the fountain view. The spanish steps, pantheon, via veneto are within walking distance. There is a great modern shopping mall just round the corner. All in all we had a great time and woudlnt hesitate in returning to this cute little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear...”
Reviews.Author: copywriter
Reviews.Content: I just cannot see why this hotel continues to get such good reviews. When we arrived our tiny room was not ready, the drains stank and the people on the front desk were disinterested. We moved to a different room which was at least clean. The bed was comfortable but the room was too small to relax in. Breakfast was simply awful. The coffee was so stewed it was undrinkable. (A tip: just next door is a lovely cafe where you sit outside and have pastries hot from the oven and really good Italian coffee.) and the room was lifeless and silent. On our first evening we had a glass of wine up in the bar, for 14 euros we were given a glass each of a red wine that been open FAR too long. It was plain rank. I would try very hard not to come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views!”
Reviews.Author: BikerBird
Reviews.Content: The Fontana doesn't look like much from the outside but don't let that put you off. The hotel and rooms may be small (space is a premium in cities like Rome) but the place is spotless and the staff are friendly and helpful (we got very detailed instructions on where to buy tickets for football and then find the Stadio Olimipco via foot, Metro and buses from reception). With cities such as Rome where there's so much to see and do, all you're really doing is showering and sleeping in your room and the Fontana is better than most city centres hotels I've stayed in. Undoubtedly, the best thing about the hotel is it's fairly central location as everything is walkable from it (Rome is a fairly compact city). Our room was on the third floor with a Trevi Fountain view which was just breathtaking. It was noisy with the window open due to the constant crowds outside (even at 11pm in Oct it was packed outside), but there was aircon in our room so no need to have the window open other than to take in the view and crowds. With the window closed, all we could hear was the fountain but I'm not so sure about rooms on lower floors and whether you'd hear the crowds. The were two downsides to our room but these were fairly minor to us. Our 3rd floor room was below the breakfast room so from around 7/8am we could just make out chairs scraping across the floor. There was also a large sliding connecting door to the next room which literally took up a third of the wallspace; this did mean that we could hear our neighbours loud and clear (nothing that banging on the wall didn't sort out!). Breakfast on the top floor was delicious with a good range of cereals, breads, fruits, meats and so on. The 2 ladies serving breakfast were lovely. From our observations, generally if you make an effort to smile and say hello in the local language, which isn't hard, your efforts will be rewarded. Please be aware of pick-pockets in Rome. I'd been warned by relatives that had purses stolen at a Metro station a few years ago, so was extra vigilent with an over the body zipped up bag, but still almost got mine pinched at The Forum (zip open and hand hovering over purse). BE CAREFUL!

Reviews.Title: “would "never" stay at the Fontana”
Reviews.Author: aglasact
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of an awkward review as my husband and I never stayed at the Fontana but we attempted to. I just want to say to other potential guests that the booking process is horrendous. We had some special requests so we contacted the hotel directly. Once our requests were confirmed we attempted to book our room through e-mail giving our CC # but the hotel wrote back and said we had to go through the link within the e-mail; we did. However, the link did not give us the opportunity to confirm the special requests we had made with them directly. We went back to the hotel directly and expressed our concern with booking "on-line" and they wrote back indicating to us that we were trying to get the room cheaper (whatever that means). We had never even concerned ourselves with price as it didn't matter what the room cost, but apparently there is a difference in price if you book directly versus on-line. Honestly we never even looked at the price of booking on-line or directly. We are not staying there as once all was said and done they told us they could not guarrantee our special requests even though they had confirmed these request in our correspondence.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and location was great, but not so great.”
Reviews.Author: SevernaParkGal
Reviews.Content: Our experience with Hotel Fontana was ok with some plusses and minuses. One of the primary advantages of this hotel was location, location, location. Fontanta is RIGHT in front of the gorgeous Trevi fountain, easy to walk to major sites in Rome, easy to find, etc. We liked the top floor terrace where breakfast was served. It overlooked the fountain and was very nice in the morning, and in the evenings we would take a bottle of wine up there before going out. The breakfast was good for us: hard boiled eggs, olives, yummy fresh baked pastries, tomatoes, cereal, juice, fruit, cheese. The ladies were friendly and accommodating. I would say our room was adequate. It was located just over the entrance facing the fountain--fantastic sight! However the din of the ever present people visiting the fountain is quite loud and the lights are very bright. We had to close the windows and drapes every night and turn on the fans in the room and even then we could still hear occasional drunks jumping into the fountain, getting arrested, etc. At times that was entertaining, at other times it was exhausting. If it had been a hot night (no a/c) and needed to open the window it would have been a major problem. The furnishings in our room were minimal and "antiquey"--meaning they were not really useable. We couldn't use the built in closet because the door would not close unless it was locked with an old key and the key would not easily unlock the closet so we just gave up. The other piece in the room was a large...uh antique something...with drawers. Too cumbersome to be useful! Our bathroom was small but clean and modern. Shower and plumbing were good. Our friends were given a microscopic room on the top floor--couldn't even fit 2 night stands in it. Actually it was a prison cell with small windows across the top. They arrived late and were too tired to complain until the next day. If it had been me I think I would have considered not paying, it was that bad. Anyway, they got moved the next day ("no problem") but it soured our first impression of the place because our friends were so uncomfortable. Frankly I think the staff was worn out from the season by the time we got there. They always started their conversation with a smile but seemed to shut down mid-sentence. It seemed to me that there was a level of irritation towards the guests. Perhaps this is due to the location of the hotel. If you are standing at the front desk there are always fountain visitors stopping in, asking questions (where's the nearest bathroom, looking to exchange money which they do as a service) so that it is difficult to have an uninterrupted conversation with the front desk person. Our luggage was lost by the airlines but was located fairly quickly. We knew where it was but needed help communicating with the airline transport to bring it out to us. Each morning and afternoon we asked for help to make a follow up call (this went on for 2 days) we were met with a level of annoyance. My sense was they would go through the motions of trying to make a call but that was it--not their problem. And it wasn't. But it was frustrating because we had no other recourse, we did not speak italian. If you like to lock your room and keep the key this is a problem as well. They got angry if you take your key with you, they want you to leave it at the front desk. If you forget or don't there is a key showdown. My husband took the key and I came back early. We had the key showdown and the front desk person scowled at me as if I were very, very bad. Wow, back to elementary school. So then time is take out to call the "helper" (Big Sigh and Major Glare) to come down from wherever, walk me to my room , unlock the door, glare at me, then leave. This is not what I want to experience when I am on vacation. Just give me the key!

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_and_Karen_Bent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Fontana in Rome from 5th until 10th September. We stayed in room 206 which directly overlooks the Trevi Fountain. The view from the window is truly awesome, you almost feel you are in the fountain, the atmosphere and the noise of the fountain is mesmerising. Having said that, we were able to sleep soundly with the window closed to dampen the noise, as there was a ceiling fan in the room it felt quite cool. The room itself wasn't large but certainly adequate and nicely furnished with a monster bed, fine for a 5 day stay and the bathroom was fine with a powerful shower and bath to rest your weary bones from all the walking! The front desk staff were polite and friendly and the 2 ladies serving tea and coffee at breakfast were helpful and welcoming. The breakfast itself was varied and plentiful although the water for tea and coffee was never very hot, which seemed to be the fashion everywhere we went! The hotel is in a great location for most major sights and we walked to the Pantheon, the Vatican, the Forum and Colesseum the Palantine hill and many other areas each day. It is also right in the middle of a great area for restaurants and shops. We tended to come back to the hotel for a rest most days at about 5pm before venturing out for dinner and although the area around the Trevi Fountain was always packed solid with people, we usually managed to sleep for an hour despite the busy location. We would recommend the hotel unreservedly to anyone who enjoys staying somewhere with character and charm. One thing to watch is that we asked reception to book us a taxi to Campiano airport on the 10th and they told us it would be 65 euros. They had forgotten to do this as we checked out so they rang for a taxi for us which cost just 31euros! I would suggest to do the same as that seems an awfully big difference in price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: loveyloo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Fontana on the last night of our glorious Italian vacation. I had originally read about the hotel in a book about charming small hotels. After reading all the negative reviews, I almost cancelled. I am glad that I didn't, because our night at the hotel was a wonderful way to end our vacation. For those expecting the Hoilday Inn, this hotel is not for you. If you are interested in a small and intimate place with lovely marble staircases, quirky hallways and charming antiques, this is the place for you. Our room was on the third floor and overlooked the Trevi Fountain. We could open our window and experience the beauty of the fountain (day and night) without the crowds. Our room was bright, simple and elegantly furnished with antiques. During our vacation in Italy, we stayed at three hotels in Rome. Our room at the Hotel Fontana was small, yet it was not the smallest room we had stayed in. The high ceiling made the room feel larger. We had ample space for our belongings and could walk about the room comfortably. The bathroom was small yet workable for the two of us. The towels and toiletries were lovely. We never ran out of hot water. The air conditioning in our room worked very well. The hotel staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. They helped us make phone calls within Italy and abroad, arranged for a private driver to take us to the airport, gave us a map of Rome and helped with directions to places that we wanted to see. The cleaning staff all smiled and said buongiorno to us when we passed in the hall. My husband and I both found the breakfast woman very friendly. I did speak Italian to her, while my husband spoke English. I agree with a fellow reviewer that the breakfast woman probably only speaks Italian and therefore can come across as unfriendly. The breakfast spread consisted of pastries, croissants, cold meats, cheese, cereal, juices and hard boiled eggs. The hotel had a toaster (!) so I could have toast for breakfast. This may seem like a trivial thing, but of the approximately 11 hotels we stayed in during our Italian vacation, only three had toasters. The area around the fountain is crowded from approximately 9:00 a.m. to well into the wee hours of the morning. With our window closed, the only sound we could hear was the sound of the fountain. This did not disturb us at all. The location is excellent and we were able to walk to the Pantheon, Colosseum and the Bocca de la Verita (mouth of truth). When we checked into the hotel, we were each given a tiny envelope with a coin in it. This was a coin to throw into the fountain to ensure that we would return to Rome one day. On our last morning in Rome (before heading out to the airport) we woke up early and went to the fountain. It was 7:00 a.m. and we had the whole piazza and fountain to ourselves! How many people can say that? The only people we saw walking through were Romans on their way to work. We threw our coins in and hope to return to Rome and the beautiful Hotel Fontana again one day. Don't be put off by the horrible reviews, the Hotel Fontana is truly a gem in the heart of Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the negative reviews, Hotel Fontana is absolutely charming!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lynifer
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful four-night stay at the Hotel Fontana (July 21 - 25, 2006). Like several other reviewers, I chose this hotel based on its wonderful location. Little did I know that it would turn out to be such a charming hotel! For those who like the chain hotels that consist of 100 or more rooms, this little boutique hotel is not for you. However, for the more discriminating traveler, one who appreciates the unconventional, you are in luck! Unfortunately, the pictures on the Hotel Fontana's website do not do the hotel justice. We stayed in Room 203. Yes, it was extremely small, but very quaint. Our friends stayed in Room 202 and their room was much bigger and had a lovely bathroom which was adequately sized for two adults. My mother and niece stayed in Room 305 and it was a dream! It had two double beds, lovely antique furniture, and the bathroom was down some winding steps and had a tub and shower. They were in heaven! What I appreciated about all three rooms was the antique furniture, the cleanliness, the fresh fruit and water every day, and the luxurious feel of the towels, toiletries, and decor. The hallways on each floor was tastefully decorated. The elevator worked fine. The breakfast was fairly large and included toast, juice, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, a couple of breakfast cakes, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and a few other items. The lady serving us was not the most friendly person, however, I attributed that to the fact that her English was not very good and so she was limited in what she could say. We were polite and she was too. We NEVER ran out of hot water. The hotel staff was friendly, Isaac and Foster in particular, were EXTREMELY delightful persons. The hotel's location is unbeatable! It is a 10 minute walk to the Spanish Steps, the Piazza Navona, the Colosseum, the Pantheon, and the list goes on and on. It is VERY centrally located. The hotel is old, in fact, it was around even before the Trevi Fountain was built. It used to be a convent. Upon finding out those tidbits of information, I was even more happy with our choice of booking with the antiquated Hotel Fontana. If I had to complain about something, my only complaint would probably have to be the air conditioner in our room didn't blow out absolute cold air. However, we were in Italy when there was a heat wave going on across Europe, so I'm sure that may have affected things some. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel and would not hesistate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Fontana for 5 days in early June 2006. This is high season so the crowds around the fountain and the hotel was quite chaotic! But what a place to experince Rome at its best! The location was central to everything and our room was clean and quite spacious. The bed was comfortable, we slept well. The breakfast was a good spread. The breakfast room is on the 3rd or 4th floor of the hotel and gives a great view of fountain------with out the crowds!!!!!!!! We enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping beside the Trevi Fountain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in Rome. My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Fontana in front of the Trevi Fountain. We loved the hotel. I'd read the Trip Advisor reviews before picking the hotel. Yes the hotel rooms are very small, but that was not a problem for us. We were gone most of the day and all we needed the room for was to sleep. Even though it was small, we loved the room. It was on the first floor overlooking Trevi Fountain. At first I was worred that the noise would keep us awake at night, but we slept like logs. If you're not a heavy sleeper, ask for a room in the back. One block from the hotel was the station for the 110 Bus, one of Rome's tour buses. Another block away was the bus station. We took the 492 to the Vatican Museum. A cab cost 8 Euro each way to Termini. The Pantheon was a 15 minute walk away, as was the Spanish Steps, and Piazza Navona. There was a deli and a cafe 10 steps from the hotel Would highly recommend, particulary if you don't mind small spaces. The hotel was charming.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Flyingredhorse
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location! Plus our room overlooked the Trevi Fountain (Three Coins in a Fountain). A bit noisy but could close the window. Earplugs might be a good investment but the hotel is worth it. The staff is helpful. We were the only Americans staying there. Many from France and South America. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Would return”
Reviews.Author: colin parham
Reviews.Content: Although we have marked this average we would stay here again. Our rooms were clean, staff friendly breakfast excellent view from breakfast room phew!!! You have to remember how old this building is - impossible to compete with modern plastic. We chose to have rooms at the rear of the building to enjoy the airconditioning but in the spring and autumn would go for front facing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - and thats all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The breakfast room overlooks the Trevi fountain and is wonderfully romantic but the hotel itself leaves a lot to be desired. The lift didn,t go to our floor, the bathroom was very small - anyone weighing over 12 stones would have trouble sitting on the toilet as it was so close to a wall. The aircon was woefully inadequate during summer ( they tried to charge us extra for it ! ) There wasn,t even a bar so no night cap chatting to other guests, nor was there a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Fontana 14th July 2005, I had searched hard for this hotel and the previous comments from other trip advisors helped me choose this one, We loved this hotel and it was in a superb location directly opposite the Trevi Fountain and we recieved a Fountain View Room, number 206, we didnt mind the noise outside and all the tourists (the area is full of tourists from 10am till midnight at least) it all added to the character of where we were and you could shut the windows which blocked out most of the noise. The rooms are small but with high ceilings and the bed in itself was a king size, the room was clean which is the main thing, and the fan above the bed did keep you cool but was a bit noisy on full speed, this is the only critical comment I have, the bathroom was well decorated and size was average. Value for money was good we paid 160 euros and it was within walking distance of everything. This hotel was typical Italian Style which is what we was looking for it was not modernised or charmless. We loved it here and would definately return without hesitation. Feel free to Email me if you have questions on this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Fontana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza di Trevi 96, 00187 Rome, Italy
